intro: Cynopaema androsaemifolium, commonly known as the Androsaemifolium plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
